line: COMPLAINT FOR VIOLATION OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934
label: heading

line: Plaintiff, by his undersigned attorneys, for this complaint against defendants, alleges upon
label: paragraph

line: personal knowledge with respect to himself, and upon information and belief based upon, inter
label: paragraph

line: alia, the investigation of counsel as to all other allegations herein, as follows:
label: paragraph

line: NATURE OF THE ACTION
label: heading

line: This action stems from a proposed transaction announced on December 19, 2019
label: paragraph

line: (the “Proposed Transaction”), pursuant to which TiVo Corporation (“TiVo” or the “Company”)
label: paragraph

line: will be acquired by Xperi Corporation, XRAY-TWOLF HoldCo Corporation (“HoldCo”), XRAY
label: paragraph

line: Merger Sub Corporation (“XRAY Merger Sub”),
label: paragraph

line: (“TWOLF Merger Sub,” and collectively, “Xperi”).
label: paragraph

line: and TWOLF Merger Sub Corporation
label: paragraph

line: On December 18, 2019, TiVo’s Board of Directors (the “Board” or “Individual
label: paragraph

line: Defendants”) caused the Company to enter into an agreement and plan of merger (the “Merger
label: paragraph

line: Case 1:20-cv-00327-UNA Document 1 Filed 03/03/20 Page 2 of 13 PageID #: 2
label: paragraph

line: Agreement”) with Xperi. Pursuant to the terms of the Merger Agreement, shareholders of TiVo
label: paragraph

line: will receive 0.455 shares of HoldCo common stock.
label: paragraph

line: On February 18, 2020, defendants filed a Form S-4 Registration Statement (the
label: paragraph

line: “Registration Statement”) with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (“SEC”)
label: paragraph

line: in connection with the Proposed Transaction.
label: paragraph

line: The Registration Statement omits material information with respect to the Proposed
label: paragraph

line: Transaction, which renders the Registration Statement false and misleading. Accordingly, plaintiff
label: paragraph

line: alleges herein that defendants violated Sections 14(a) and 20(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of
label: paragraph

line: 1934 (the “1934 Act”) in connection with the Registration Statement.
label: paragraph

line: JURISDICTION AND VENUE
label: heading

line: This Court has jurisdiction over the claims asserted herein pursuant to Section 27
label: paragraph

line: of the 1934 Act because the claims asserted herein arise under Sections 14(a) and 20(a) of the 1934
label: paragraph

line: Act and Rule 14a-9.
label: paragraph

line: This Court has jurisdiction over defendants because each defendant is either a
label: paragraph

line: corporation that conducts business in and maintains operations within this District, or is an
label: paragraph

line: individual with sufficient minimum contacts with this District so as to make the exercise of
label: paragraph

line: jurisdiction by this Court permissible under traditional notions of fair play and substantial justice.
label: paragraph

line: Venue is proper under 28 U.S.C. § 1391(b) because a substantial portion of the
label: paragraph

line: transactions and wrongs complained of herein occurred in this District.
label: paragraph

line: CLASS ACTION ALLEGATIONS
label: heading

line: Plaintiff brings this action as a class action on behalf of himself and the other public
label: paragraph

line: stockholders of TiVo (the “Class”). Excluded from the Class are defendants herein and any person,
label: paragraph

line: firm, trust, corporation, or other entity related to or affiliated with any defendant.
label: paragraph

line: This action is properly maintainable as a class action.
label: paragraph

line: The Class is so numerous that joinder of all members is impracticable. As of
label: paragraph

line: December 16, 2019, there were approximately 126,666,160 shares of TiVo common stock
label: paragraph

line: outstanding, held by hundreds, if not thousands, of individuals and entities scattered throughout
label: paragraph

line: the country.
label: paragraph

line: Questions of law and fact are common to the Class, including, among others,
label: paragraph

line: whether defendants will irreparably harm plaintiff
label: paragraph

line: defendants’ conduct complained of herein continues.
label: paragraph

line: and the other members of the Class if
label: paragraph

line: Plaintiff is committed to prosecuting this action and has retained competent counsel
label: paragraph

line: experienced in litigation of this nature. Plaintiff’s claims are typical of the claims of the other
label: paragraph

line: members of the Class and plaintiff has the same interests as the other members of the Class.
label: paragraph

line: Accordingly, plaintiff is an adequate representative of the Class and will fairly and adequately
label: paragraph

line: protect the interests of the Class.
label: paragraph

line: The prosecution of separate actions by individual members of the Class would
label: paragraph

line: create the risk of inconsistent or varying adjudications that would establish incompatible standards
label: paragraph

line: of conduct for defendants, or adjudications that would, as a practical matter, be dispositive of the
label: paragraph

line: interests of individual members of the Class who are not parties to the adjudications or would
label: paragraph

line: substantially impair or impede those non-party Class members’ ability to protect their interests.
label: paragraph

line: Case 1:20-cv-00327-UNA Document 1 Filed 03/03/20 Page 5 of 13 PageID #: 5
label: paragraph

line: Defendants have acted, or refused to act, on grounds generally applicable to the
label: paragraph

line: Class as a whole, and are causing injury to the entire Class.
label: paragraph

line: behalf of the Class is appropriate.
label: paragraph

line: Therefore, final injunctive relief on
label: paragraph

line: SUBSTANTIVE ALLEGATIONS
label: heading

line: Background of the Company and the Proposed Transaction
label: heading

line: TiVo provides an intellectual property portfolio and products to help consumers
label: paragraph

line: watch entertainment.
label: paragraph

line: The Company’s products include movies, videos, and shows from across live TV,
label: paragraph

line: on demand, streaming services, and apps.
label: paragraph

line: On December 18, 2019, TiVo’s Board caused the Company to enter into the Merger
label: paragraph

line: Agreement with Xperi.
label: paragraph

line: Pursuant to the terms of the Merger Agreement, Tivo’s stockholders will receive
label: paragraph

line: 0.455 shares of Holdco common stock for each share of TiVo common stock they own.
label: paragraph

line: According to the press release announcing the Proposed Transaction:
label: paragraph

line: Xperi Corporation (Nasdaq: XPER) and TiVo Corporation (Nasdaq: TIVO) today
label: paragraph

line: announced they entered into a definitive agreement to combine in an all-stock
label: paragraph

line: transaction, representing approximately $3 billion of combined enterprise value.
label: paragraph

line: The transaction creates a leading consumer and entertainment technology business
label: paragraph

line: and one of the industry’s largest intellectual property (IP) licensing platforms with
label: paragraph

line: a diverse portfolio of entertainment and semiconductor intellectual property.
label: paragraph

line: The merger agreement provides for a 0.455 fixed exchange ratio, which implies a
label: paragraph

line: 15% premium to TiVo’s shareholders based on each of Xperi’s and TiVo’s 90-day
label: paragraph

line: volume-weighted average share prices. At close, Xperi shareholders will own
label: paragraph

line: approximately 46.5% of the combined business, and TiVo shareholders will own
label: paragraph

line: approximately 53.5%. . . .
label: paragraph

line: Transaction Details
label: paragraph

line: Under the terms of the merger agreement, the shares of TiVo and Xperi
label: paragraph

line: stockholders will be converted into the shares of the new parent company based on
label: paragraph

line: a fixed exchange ratio of 0.455 Xperi share
label: paragraph

line: per existing TiVo share. Upon
label: paragraph

line: Case 1:20-cv-00327-UNA Document 1 Filed 03/03/20 Page 6 of 13 PageID #: 6
label: paragraph

line: completion of the merger, Xperi stockholders will own approximately 46.5% and
label: paragraph

line: TiVo stockholders will own approximately 53.5% of the new parent company on a
label: paragraph

line: fully diluted basis.
label: paragraph

line: In connection with the transaction each company’s debt will be refinanced on a
label: paragraph

line: combined basis. To meet this objective, the companies have secured $1.1 billion of
label: paragraph

line: committed financing from Bank of America and Royal Bank of Canada.
label: paragraph

line: Management and Board of Directors
label: paragraph

line: Following the completion of the transaction, Xperi’s Chief Executive Officer, Jon
label: paragraph

line: Kirchner, will serve as Chief Executive Officer of the new parent company and
label: paragraph

line: Xperi’s CFO, Robert Andersen, will serve as Chief Financial Officer. TiVo’s Chief
label: paragraph

line: Executive Officer, David Shull, will continue as a strategic advisor to ensure a
label: paragraph

line: successful integration.
label: paragraph

line: The Board of Directors of the new parent company will consist of seven directors,
label: paragraph

line: including Xperi CEO Jon Kirchner, in addition to three directors appointed by
label: paragraph

line: Xperi and three directors appointed by TiVo. The
label: paragraph

line: selected by the independent directors of the Board.
label: paragraph

line: Chair of the Board will be
label: paragraph

line: The new parent company will assume the Xperi name but will continue to provide
label: paragraph

line: entertainment services under the TiVo brand, alongside Xperi’s premium DTS®,
label: paragraph

line: HD Radio®, and IMAX® Enhanced brands. The company will be headquartered
label: paragraph

line: in San Jose, California.
label: paragraph

line: Timing and Approvals
label: paragraph

line: This transaction has been approved by the Boards of Directors of both companies
label: paragraph

line: and is expected to close during the second quarter of 2020, subject to regulatory
label: paragraph

line: approvals, the approval by the shareholders of each company, and other customary
label: paragraph

line: closing conditions. . . .
label: paragraph

line: Advisors
label: paragraph

line: Centerview Partners, LLC served as exclusive financial advisor to Xperi and
label: paragraph

line: Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP served as legal advisor. LionTree
label: paragraph

line: Advisors LLC served as
label: paragraph

line: served as legal advisor.
label: paragraph

line: exclusive financial advisor

line: The Registration Statement Omits Material Information
label: heading

line: to TiVo and Cooley LLP
label: paragraph

line: Defendants filed the Registration Statement with the SEC in connection with the
label: paragraph

line: Proposed Transaction.
label: paragraph

line: Case 1:20-cv-00327-UNA Document 1 Filed 03/03/20 Page 7 of 13 PageID #: 7
label: paragraph

line: As set forth below, the Registration Statement omits material information with
label: paragraph

line: respect to the Proposed
label: paragraph

line: misleading.
label: paragraph

line: Transaction, which renders the Registration Statement false and
label: paragraph

line: First, the Registration Statement omits material information regarding the
label: paragraph

line: Company’s, Xperi’s, and the combined company’s financial projections.
label: paragraph

line: With respect to the Company’s financial projections, the Registration Statement
label: paragraph

line: fails to disclose, for each set of projections: (i) all line items used to calculate (a) Adjusted
label: paragraph

line: EBITDA, (b) EBIT, and (c) Unlevered Free Cash Flow; and (ii) a reconciliation of all non-GAAP
label: paragraph

line: to GAAP metrics.
label: paragraph

line: With respect to Xperi’s financial projections, the Registration Statement fails to
label: paragraph

line: disclose, for each set of projections: (i) all line items used to calculate (a) Billings, (b) Adjusted
label: paragraph

line: EBITDA, and (c) Unlevered Free Cash Flow; and (ii) a reconciliation of all non-GAAP to GAAP
label: paragraph

line: metrics.
label: paragraph

line: With respect to the combined company’s financial projections, the Registration
label: paragraph

line: Statement fails to disclose: (i) all line items used to calculate (a) Billings and (b) Adjusted
label: paragraph

line: EBITDA; (ii) Unlevered Free Cash Flow and all underlying line items; and (iii) a reconciliation of
label: paragraph

line: all non-GAAP to GAAP metrics.
label: paragraph

line: The disclosure of projected financial information is material because it provides
label: paragraph

line: stockholders with a basis to project the future financial performance of a company, and allows
label: paragraph

line: stockholders to better understand the financial analyses performed by the company’s financial
label: paragraph

line: advisor in support of its fairness opinion.
label: paragraph

line: Second, the Registration Statement omits material information regarding the
label: paragraph

line: analyses performed by the Company’s financial advisor in
label: paragraph

line: connection with the Proposed
label: paragraph

line: Case 1:20-cv-00327-UNA Document 1 Filed 03/03/20
label: paragraph

line: Transaction, LionTree Advisors LLC (“LionTree”).
label: paragraph

line: Page 8 of 13 PageID #: 8
label: paragraph

line: With respect to LionTree’s Sum-of-the-Parts DCF Analysis of the Company, the
label: paragraph

line: Registration Statement fails to disclose: (i) all line items used to calculate unlevered free cash
label: paragraph

line: flows; (ii) the terminal values; (iii) LionTree’s basis for applying ranges of terminal multiples of
label: paragraph

line: 8.0x to 10.0x and 4.75x to 5.75x; (iv) the individual inputs and assumptions underlying the
label: paragraph

line: discount rates ranging from 9.0% to 11.0%; (v) the estimated consolidated net debt used by
label: paragraph

line: LionTree in the analysis; and (vi) the number of fully diluted shares outstanding of TiVo common
label: paragraph

line: stock.
label: paragraph

line: With respect to LionTree’s Sum-of-the-Parts DCF Analysis of Xperi, the
label: paragraph

line: Registration Statement fails to disclose: (i) all line items used to calculate unlevered free cash
label: paragraph

line: flows; (ii) the terminal values; (iii) LionTree’s basis for applying ranges of terminal multiples of
label: paragraph

line: 9.0x to 11.0x and 3.0x to 5.0x; (iv) the individual inputs and assumptions underlying the discount
label: paragraph

line: rates ranging from 8.75% to 10.75%; (v) the estimated consolidated net debt used by LionTree in
label: paragraph

line: the analysis; and (vi) the number of fully diluted shares outstanding of Xperi common stock.
label: paragraph

line: With respect to LionTree’s Pro Forma Financial Analyses, the Registration
label: paragraph

line: Statement fails to disclose: (i) the individual inputs and assumptions underlying the discount rates
label: paragraph

line: ranging from 8.9% to 10.9%; (ii) the terminal values; and (iii) LionTree’s basis for applying ranges
label: paragraph

line: of terminal value multiples of 6.0x to 8.0x and 7.0x to 9.0x.
label: paragraph

line: When a banker’s endorsement of the fairness of a transaction is touted to
label: paragraph

line: shareholders, the valuation methods used to arrive at that opinion as well as the key inputs and
label: paragraph

line: range of ultimate values generated by those analyses must also be fairly disclosed.
label: paragraph

line: Third, the Registration Statement omits material information regarding potential
label: paragraph

line: conflicts of interest of LionTree.
label: paragraph

line: Case 1:20-cv-00327-UNA Document 1 Filed 03/03/20 Page 9 of 13 PageID #: 9
label: paragraph

line: The Registration Statement fails to disclose whether LionTree has provided past
label: paragraph

line: services to Xperi or its affiliates, as well as the timing and nature of such services and the amount
label: paragraph

line: of compensation LionTree received for providing such services.
label: paragraph

line: Full disclosure of investment banker compensation and all potential conflicts is
label: paragraph

line: required due to the central role played by investment
label: paragraph

line: selection, and implementation of strategic alternatives.
label: paragraph

line: banks in the evaluation, exploration,
label: paragraph

line: Fourth, the Registration Statement fails to disclose whether the Company entered
label: paragraph

line: into any nondisclosure agreements that contained standstill and/or “don’t ask, don’t waive”
label: paragraph

line: provisions that are or were preventing the counterparties from submitting superior offers to acquire
label: paragraph

line: the Company.
label: paragraph

line: Without this information, stockholders may have the mistaken belief that, if these
label: paragraph

line: potentially interested parties wished to come forward with a superior offer, they are or were
label: paragraph

line: permitted to do so, when in fact they are or were contractually prohibited from doing so.
label: paragraph

line: The omission of the above-referenced material information renders the Registration
label: paragraph

line: Statement false and misleading, including, inter alia, the following sections of the Registration
label: paragraph

line: Statement: (i) Background of the Mergers; (ii) Recommendation of the TiVo Board of Directors;
label: paragraph

line: (iii) Opinion of TiVo’s Financial Advisor; and (iv) Financial Forecasts.
label: paragraph

line: The above-referenced omitted information, if disclosed, would significantly alter
label: paragraph

line: the total mix of information available to the Company’s stockholders.
label: paragraph

line: COUNT II
label: heading

line: Page 11 of 13 PageID #: 11
label: paragraph

line: Claim for Violation of Section 20(a) of the 1934 Act
label: heading

line: Against the Individual Defendants and Xperi
label: heading

line: Plaintiff repeats and realleges the preceding allegations as if fully set forth herein.
label: paragraph

line: The Individual Defendants and Xperi acted as controlling persons of TiVo within
label: paragraph

line: the meaning of Section 20(a) of the 1934 Act as alleged herein. By virtue of their positions as
label: paragraph

line: officers and/or Board members of TiVo and participation in and/or awareness of the Company’s
label: paragraph

line: operations and/or intimate knowledge of the false statements contained in the Registration
label: paragraph

line: Statement, they had the power to influence and control and did influence and control, directly or
label: paragraph

line: indirectly, the decision making of the Company, including the content and dissemination of the
label: paragraph

line: various statements that plaintiff contends are false and misleading.
label: paragraph

line: Each of the Individual Defendants and Xperi was provided with or had unlimited
label: paragraph

line: access to copies of the Registration Statement alleged by plaintiff to be misleading prior to and/or
label: paragraph

line: shortly after these statements were issued
label: paragraph

line: statements or cause them to be corrected.
label: paragraph

line: and had the ability to prevent the issuance of the
label: paragraph

line: In particular, each of the Individual Defendants had direct and supervisory
label: paragraph

line: involvement in the day-to-day operations of the Company, and, therefore, is presumed to have had
label: paragraph

line: the power to control and influence the particular transactions giving rise to the violations as alleged
label: paragraph

line: herein, and exercised the same. The Registration Statement contains the unanimous
label: paragraph

line: recommendation of the Individual Defendants to approve the Proposed Transaction. They were
label: paragraph

line: thus directly involved in the making of the Registration Statement.
label: paragraph

line: Xperi also had supervisory control over the composition of the Registration
label: paragraph

line: Statement and the information disclosed therein, as well as the information that was omitted and/or
label: paragraph

line: misrepresented in the Registration Statement.
label: paragraph

line: Case 1:20-cv-00327-UNA Document 1 Filed 03/03/20 Page 12 of 13 PageID #: 12
label: paragraph

line: By virtue of the foregoing, the Individual Defendants and Xperi violated Section
label: paragraph

line: 20(a) of the 1934 Act.
label: paragraph

line: As set forth above, the Individual Defendants and Xperi had the ability to exercise
label: paragraph

line: control over and did control a person or persons who have each violated Section 14(a) of the 1934
label: paragraph

line: Act and Rule 14a-9, by their acts and omissions as alleged herein. By virtue of their positions as
